wikitext.*: {{short description|CEO of the Tolkien Society}} {{author infobox | image= | name=Shaun Gunner | born=[[4 March]], [[1988]]{{webcite|articleurl=http://twitter.com/ShaunGunner/status/970418118668546048?s=19|articlename="Shaun Gunner on Twitter"|website=[http://www.twitter.com Twitter]|dated=4 March 2018|accessed=21 January 2021}} | died= | education=University of Sussex{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.linkedin.com/in/shaungunner|articlename=Shaun Gunner|accessed=21 January 2021|website=[http://www.linkedin.com/ LinkedIn]}} | occupation=CEO of [[The Tolkien Society]] | location=Rustington, United Kingdom{{webcite|articleurl=http://democracy.arun.gov.uk/mgUserInfo.aspx?UID=225|articlename=Councillor Shaun Gunner|accessed=21 January 2021|website=[http://www.arun.gov.uk Arun District Council]}} | website=[http://www.shaungunner.com shaungunner.com] }} '''Shaun Gunner''' is the Chief Executive Officer of the of [[The Tolkien Society]].{{webcite|author=Daniel Helen|articleurl=https://www.tolkiensociety.org/2025/06/tolkien-society-appoints-new-chief-executive/|articlename=Tolkien Society appoints new Chief Executive|date=2 June 2025|website=TS|accessed=2 June 2025}} Gunner previously served for over 12 years as the Chair of the Society, making him the longest-serving Chair in the Society's history. Gunner has also served as the Society's publicity officer, was the Deputy Chair of [[The Return of the Ring|The Return of the Ring: Celebrating Tolkien in 2012]],Lyn Whitaker, "Along the Road", [[Amon Hen 234|''Amon Hen'' 234]], p. 8 and was responsible for the [[Tolkien 2019]] event. He has also contributed to the journals ''[[Amon Hen (journal)|Amon Hen]]'', ''[[Hither Shore (journal)|Hither Shore]]'', and ''[[Mallorn (journal)|Mallorn]]''. He is an administrator ([[User:Mith]]) of the [[Tolkien Gateway]] website, and an advisor and assistant to [[Emil Johansson]]'s [[The Lord of the Rings Project]].Shaun Gunner, "Member Profile", [[Amon Hen 235|''Amon Hen'' 235]], pp. 33-34 Gunner is also a regular commentator on Tolkien and adaptations in the media, and was a guest co-host of [[The Prancing Pony Podcast]] in the 2022-3 season.{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://theprancingponypodcast.com/about|articlename=About|dated=|website=[https://theprancingponypodcast.com/about The Prancing Pony Podcast]|accessed=23 July 2023}} Gunner is a politics graduate and lives in [[Wikipedia:Rustington|Rustington]], [[Wikipedia:Sussex|Sussex]].{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://twitter.com/#!/@ShaunGunner|articlename=Shaun Gunner|dated=|website=[http://twitter.com Twitter.com]|accessed=20 June 2012}}{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://archiver.co/profile/shaungunner|articlename=Shaun Gunner|dated=|website=[http://archiver.co/ Archiver.co]|accessed=20 June 2012}} He is an elected councillor for his area - serving as Leader of the Council between 2021 and 2023{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://democracy.arun.gov.uk/mgUserInfo.aspx?UID=255|articlename=Councillor Shaun Gunner|dated=|website=[https://www.arun.gov.uk Arun District Council]|accessed=23 July 2023}} - and formerly chaired the mental health charity [https://mkcharity.org/ Mankind]. ==Bibliography== ===Articles=== * [[2012]]: [[Amon Hen 234|''Amon Hen'' 234]] ** "[[Birthday Toast#Tolkien Society tradition|Birthday Toast]] -
